title: In batch how do I get letters after characters?
body:
I use fart app to find and replace text, I am replacing the string with sys time.

@echo off
set hr=%time:~0,2%%time:~3,2%
set hr=%hr: =0%
@echo on
fart Test.txt HHmmXXXX HHmm%hr%

HHmmXXXX is the part I need help with. It finds HHmm and always 4 digits after, I want to replace the 4 substrings after the HHmm that I noted as XXXX (no matter what they are) with the HHmm%hr%

I am just not getting the syntax right to replace the XXXX i thought asterisks would work but no.
